intro: Centaurea intybacea var. grandifolia, commonly known as the largeflowered knapweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branched stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped, serrated, and covered in a dense layer of white to grayish pubescence. The showy flowers, which bloom in summer, consist of a central disk surrounded by bright yellow ray florets, making it a striking addition to gardens and natural habitats.
